text: it's getting so you can't even cross
town in the city anymore without running
into some gladiator gridlock that's what
I ran into on the east side of Manhattan
on Saturday it was fierce Romulus in her
cherry and urging her troops onward to
First Avenue and bloodthirsty realists
being conveyed across town and down past
Dangerfield's comedy clay all to the
background of epic music being pumped
from some booming chariot stereos as the
troops battle Manhattan traffic they
drew attention from cops and from
motorists this woman tried to flee the
field of battle and this guy started
offering directions to Queens what is it
we run something calling like a lot
so wherever you told them to go that way
that's what is Leslie Carter going over
the bridge to know about 500 people in
front
we all turned out to be part of an
annual events comically based on the
Iditarod dog sled race they call it the
idiot arad and many of the racers are
from Brooklyn they come up with zany
themes upon which to base costumes and
souped-up shopping carts of course is a
chaotic one through city streets and
these gladiators had their hands full
trying to ease their chariots up and
down curbs and avoid potholes the
gladiators pushed on along the route and
later put down their weapons and
convened with the other groups in a
Brooklyn bar leaving the city
temporarily free of Roman gladiators
